critique: The document is an executive order regarding the bonds of collectors of customs. As the President, the primary emotions I want to elicit are likely related to trust, stability, and confidence in the government's financial management. The tone is formal and authoritative, aiming for a sense of order and control. There isn't much emotional language, so the scores will be relatively low. Initial assessment: Joy: 2 (confidence in the system), Sadness: 1 (no intention to evoke sadness), Anger: 1 (no intention to evoke anger), Fear: 1 (aiming to reduce financial uncertainty), Disgust: 1 (no intention to evoke disgust), Surprise: 1 (no intention to evoke surprise). Upon review, the document is very procedural and aims to establish a clear, consistent method for handling customs bonds. The emotional impact is minimal, primarily focused on reassurance and stability. Revised assessment: Joy: 3, Sadness: 1, Anger: 1, Fear: 1, Disgust: 1, Surprise: 1
